phase3.gui.ImageCanvas



class ImageCanvas: org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas.Canvas;
The ImageCanvas stores and displays all of the pixels in the current image.

Authors:
Zachery Burris (zburris@uncc.edu) and Richard Voelker (rvoelker@uncc.edu)

Date:
April 20, 2014

this(Composite parent, ColorManager colorManager, Color gridColor, uint width, uint height, uint pixelWidth, uint pixelHeight, bool showGrid);
Creates a new ImageCanvas.

Params:
Composite parent The Composite that contains this ImageCanvas.

Date:
April 20, 2014

void setPixelClickListener(PixelClickListener pixelClickListener);
Params:
PixelClickListener pixelClickListener The PixelClickListener to be fired whenever a pixel in this ImageCanvas is clicked.

Date:
April 20, 2014

RGBColor getPixelColor(int x, int y);
Params:
int x The x-coordinate of the pixel.
int y The y-coordinate of the pixel.

Returns:
The pixel RGBColor at the given x and y coordinates.

Date:
April 20, 2014

void setPixelColor(RGBColor color, int x, int y);
Params:
RGBColor color The RGBColor to change the pixel to.
int x The x-coordinate of the pixel.
int y The y-coordinate of the pixel.

Date:
April 20, 2014

RGBColor[][] getPixelColors();
Returns:
The 2-dimensional array of pixel colors.

Date:
April 21, 2014

void setPixelColors(RGBColor[][] pixelColors);
Params:
RGBColor[][] pixelColors The 2-dimensional array of the colors.

Date:
April 21, 2014

uint getWidth();
Returns:
The width of this ImageCanvas.

Date:
April 23, 2014

uint getHeight();
Returns:
The height of this ImageCanvas.

Date:
April 23, 2014
